PERFORMANCE CPP - Minimal implementation


IF AND WHEN A C++ IMPLEMENTATION IS NEEDED:

The key benefit of the C++ version is compiling the framework together with QuickJS and SQLite into a single WASM file. This would greatly improve framework load times and runtime performance. This is even more important given that Chrome unloads tabs from memory, requiring a full reload on tab switch.

The reference (TypeScript) implementation "dogfoods" wherever possible. C++ implementation should be coded for optimal performance. Thus:
  • Pre-define well-known internal queries in SQL strings.
  • Re-write the query serialization logic to create a flat JSON object tree of the query definition as seen in the query definition code (very minimal). This will reduce the bundle size (and memory footprint) for every Application loaded via QuickJS.
  • Re-write the query processing code in the framework to adjust for the new serialized format.

In general, simplify the C++ version to improve runtime performance and memory footprint. This should also result in lower initial load times but that isn't a goal in and of itself.
